item.title: Optimal Regression Design
item.description: Objective This tutorial introduces optimal regression design in the context of ordinary least squares (OLS). The goal is to strategically select the input values (design points) that yield the most precise and efficient estimates of regression parameters. $$ y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 x + \varepsilon, \quad \varepsilon \sim N(0, \sigma^2) $$ What is optimal design? In the regression context, optimal design refers to selecting design points that optimize a statistical criterion.

item.title: MFCF computing resource shortguide
item.description: Only read if you wanna use school server Which Operating System do you use? In all OS, you can use Terminal or cmd to connect, but I perfer not using it as a beginner. Windows, depends on the version of your OS… but I strongly recommend using WSL2. Otherwise, you may use Putty. In addition, I think MobaXterm is a good choice to connect to the servers. MacOS, well… you may just use terminal.

item.title: Example R Markdown Post
item.description: Using R Markdown for Blog Posts This is an example of how to use R Markdown to create blog posts with executable R code.
